name: Oda Nobunaga Den
overview: Oda Nobunaga (June 23, 1534-June 21, 1582) was a major daimyo during the Sengoku period of Japanese history. He was the second son of Oda Nobuhide, a deputy shugo (military governor) with land holdings in Owari province. Nobunaga lived a life of continuous military conquest, eventually conquering a third of Japanese daimyo before his death in 1582. His successor, Toyotomi Hideyoshi, a loyal Oda supporter, would eventually become the first man to conquer all of Japan. Oda Nobunaga Den is a strategy game made by Koei in 1998 based on the life of Oda Nobunaga. In the game the player can use money to build an army (normal soldiers, archers, etc) and build new weapons and improve the weapons too. Before each battle he can choose his army and ask his soldiers for advices. When the player is ready he can go to the battle. The battle part is a tactical rpg, the player characters got a range of movement and when is near an enemy he can choose what kind of attack he wants to use.
